macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Wall Street Bloodbath: Major Indexes Plunge as Tech Stocks and Bitcoin Tumble
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 1.2% to 6,798.40, Dow dropped 592 points (1.2%) to 48,908.72, and Nasdaq sank 1.6% to 22,540.59 amid sharp tech declines and Bitcoin plunging 10% to $63,000. Soft US labor data fueled fears of AI-driven job displacement, driving investors to US Treasuries and the dollar.

items.title: Alphabet Posts Record Profits but Stock Hammered in Broader Selloff
items.summary: Google reported record profits in its earnings, yet its stock was hit hard, contributing to waves of selling across tech and software sectors with some leveraged ETFs down 30%. McKesson surged 16.5% on strong earnings and raised profit forecast.

items.title: Central Banks Hold Rates Steady Amid Global Market Declines
items.summary: Bank of England and European Central Bank kept interest rates unchanged, while abroad indexes fell: FTSE 100 -0.9%, CAC 40 -0.3%, DAX -0.5%, and South Korea's Kospi -3.9%. US 10-year Treasury yield dropped to 4.19%.

items.title: Commodities Crash: Silver Dives 10%, Bitcoin and Metals in Freefall
items.summary: Silver dropped 10% to $73, Bitcoin fell 10% to $63,000 with altcoins down 20%+, crude oil lost $1.55/barrel, and gold off $27/oz. Volatility spiked with VIX closing at 21.77 above its 200-day MA.

items.title: S&P 500 at Make-or-Break as VIX Signals Rising Volatility
items.summary: Bulls face critical moment near key S&P level with VIX rising above 200-day MA for two days, triggering sell signals in some indicators despite bullish new highs on NYSE. Volatility derivatives remain upward sloping for now.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Dips Under $70,000, Down 20% in 2026
items.summary: Bitcoin has fallen below $US70,000, marking a 20% decline since the start of 2026 and a 45% drop from its November peak of over $US126,000. The cryptocurrency hit a low of $US66,675 on Thursday, its weakest since October 2024.

items.title: Crypto Bloodbath: $2.1 Billion Liquidated as Bitcoin Nears $60,000
items.summary: Over $2.12 billion in cryptocurrency positions were liquidated amid Bitcoin's sharp decline toward $60,000. The market turmoil reflects ongoing selling pressure in the sector.

items.title: Crypto Winter Worsens with 10 Red Flags Including Institutional Shifts and AI Competition
items.summary: The crypto market faces a severe downturn highlighted by falling prices, institutional focus on tech over tokens, AI diverting mining resources, and reduced developer interest in blockchain. Despite a pro-crypto US administration, no policy rebound is evident.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Anthropic Releases Claude Opus 4.6, Outperforming OpenAI's GPT-5.2
items.summary: Anthropic unveiled Claude Opus 4.6 on Thursday, a new high-performing AI model that surpasses OpenAI's GPT-5.2 by 144 Elo points and excels in coding, long-context tasks, and information retrieval benchmarks like BrowseComp and MRCR v2.

items.title: Survey Reveals 1.5 Million AI Agents at Risk of Going Rogue in US and UK Firms
items.summary: A Gravitee study of 750 IT executives shows over half of 3 million deployed AI agents are ungoverned and unmonitored, highlighting risks of 'invisible AI' and the need for continuous oversight amid rapid deployment.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Take-Two CEO Promises GTA 6 is Fully Handcrafted, No Generative AI Involved
items.summary: Take-Two Interactive CEO Strauss Zelnick assured fans that Grand Theft Auto 6 contains no generative AI, with every element handcrafted by humans, despite using AI elsewhere to cut costs. The game is set for release on November 19, 2026, after multiple delays amid a $2 billion budget.

items.title: Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase Announces Bethesda Titles for Switch 2
items.summary: Nintendo revealed Bethesda franchises debuting on Switch 2, including Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, Fallout 4: Anniversary Edition, and The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered. Other announcements include Turok: Origins, WWE 2K26, Goat Simulator 3, and more for Switch and Switch 2.

items.title: For Honor Patch 2.65.2 Fixes Customization, Emotes, Audio, and Outfit Bugs
items.summary: Ubisoft released patch notes for For Honor addressing issues like mismatched ornaments on Gao Lei’s Keepsake, uncancelable emotes, persistent audio SFX, and missing ornaments on outfits.

items.title: Typhlosion with Mightiest Mark Returns to Pokémon 7-Star Tera Raid Battles
items.summary: The Volcano Pokémon Typhlosion with the Mightiest Mark is available in 7-Star Tera Raid Battles from February 6, 00:00 UTC to February 12, 23:59 UTC at black Tera Raid crystals.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
